page.title: 04FIRE SERVICE IN BALFRON
page.content: Balfron{Fire Brigade}is what is known as a "Retained Brigade", which means that the firemen are all {volunteers}who have another job which they do unless they are called out to fight a fire. The firemen all carry a pocket "Bleeper" which alerts them when they are needed. In Balfron there are ten firemen altogether. They meet to practise on two nights in the week. They have one fire-engine which they keep well serviced always. They attend about{one {hundred fires}each year, the most common being grass fires and house fires. Sometimes the Fire Brigade is called out to car accidents, on average about twenty in a year. They have been known to{save}animals too, { for example when a kitten is stuck up a tree and cannot climb down.
